intro: Pseudorlaya, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its striking, bioluminescent flowers that glow faintly in the dark. Due to habitat loss and climate change, Pseudorlaya is considered critically endangered.
